alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN BROWN, SOUTH CENTRAL CLINTON AND WEST CENTRAL HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lynchburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lynchburg, Russell, Fayetteville, St. Martin and Chasetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
